I got the following exception trying to add a getter for an instance variable 
to a class. I choose the instance variable and ran Source/Generate Getters and 
Setters, deselected the setter and clicked OK. The oepration failed with the 
following exception. This is with Eclipse 3.0 and I have the entire source for 
Eclipse SDK loaded from CVS (in case it matters).

Can you attach the class that shows the problem.
*** Bug 70024 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=13414)
Java file that causes the exception

Here's the file that caused the exception for me.

I should add that I was trying to create a getter for the "selected" instance 
variable.

Steps to reproduce:

- create class A with one field
- create class B with one field and a method
- class all editors
- create getter for field in class B. Specify the as the insert position the 
  method existing in B. Make sure that you activate the action from the 
  package explorer without opening the file
- create getter for field in class A. Don't change the insert position and
  again make sure the the action is activated from the package explorer without
  having the file open. 

The problem is as follows:

- when creating the setter for class B the action stores the selection
  insert position in the dialog store
- when creating the setter for class A the stored insert position is used.
  Since the insert position isn't valid in class A (it has less members than
  B) we access the array outside of its bounds.

Created an attachment (id=13446)
Patch that fixes the problem

Correction to the steps to reproduce:

- class B must have two methods and the generated methods must be insert
  after the last method. To do so select the last method from the combo. 
  Don't use the generic entry "Last method".
Fix released to Head as well.
Verified OK. Somebody please change the status to Verified.
more precisely, verified in the 3.1 M1 candidate (Build id: 200408101200)
